meanings.definition: Raised as a topic for discussion or debate.
meanings.sent1: The mooted idea sparked a lively debate among the students.
meanings.sent2: The mooted solution to the problem was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: The mooted plan to have a pizza party every day seemed a bit excessive.
meanings.sent4: Her mooted suggestion to paint the classroom walls black was quickly dismissed.
meanings.sent5: The mooted change in the school schedule caused quite a stir among the teachers.

meanings.sent1: The mooted changes to the project were well-received by the team.
meanings.sent2: The mooted idea of a team-building retreat was met with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: His mooted plan to have a pet hamster in the office raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The mooted addition of a new character to the story added an interesting twist.
meanings.sent5: The mooted budget cuts caused concern among the employees.

meanings.sent1: The mooted decision to change the company's logo led to heated discussions.
meanings.sent2: The mooted policy changes were met with resistance from the employees.
meanings.sent3: The mooted idea of having a casual dress code was a topic of much debate.
meanings.sent4: The mooted trade agreement between the two countries faced strong opposition.
meanings.sent5: The mooted merger between the two companies was a subject of intense scrutiny.
